00052 /**************************************************************************/
00059 void MICROSD_init(void)
00060 {
00061   /* Enabling clock to USART 0 */
00062   CMU_ClockEnable(MICROSD_CMUCLOCK, true);
00063   CMU_ClockEnable(cmuClock_GPIO, true);
00064 
00065   /* Setup SPI at USART0 */
00066   spi = MICROSD_DEVICE;
00067 
00068   /* Setting baudrate */
00069   FCLK_SLOW();
00070 
00071   /* Configure SPI */
00072   /* Using synchronous (SPI) mode*/
00073   spi->CTRL = USART_CTRL_SYNC | USART_CTRL_MSBF;
00074   /* Clearing old transfers/receptions, and disabling interrupts */
00075   spi->CMD = USART_CMD_CLEARRX | USART_CMD_CLEARTX;
00076   spi->IEN = 0;
00077   /* Enabling pins and setting location, SPI CS not enable */
00078   spi->ROUTE = USART_ROUTE_TXPEN | USART_ROUTE_RXPEN | USART_ROUTE_CLKPEN | MICROSD_LOC;
00079   /* Enabling TX and RX */
00080   spi->CMD = USART_CMD_TXEN | USART_CMD_RXEN;
00081 
00082   /* Set to master and without controlling the CS line */
00083   spi->CMD = USART_CMD_MASTEREN;
00084 
00085   /* Clear previous interrupts */
00086   spi->IFC = _USART_IFC_MASK;
00087 
00088   /* IO configuration (USART 0, Location #1) */
00089   GPIO_PinModeSet(MICROSD_GPIOPORT, MICROSD_MOSIPIN, gpioModePushPull, 0);  /* MOSI */
00090   GPIO_PinModeSet(MICROSD_GPIOPORT, MICROSD_MISOPIN, gpioModeInputPull, 1); /* MISO */
00091   GPIO_PinModeSet(MICROSD_GPIOPORT, MICROSD_CSPIN, gpioModePushPull, 0);  /* CS */
00092   GPIO_PinModeSet(MICROSD_GPIOPORT, MICROSD_CLKPIN, gpioModePushPull, 0);  /* Clock */
00093 }
00094 
00095 /**************************************************************************/
00100 void MICROSD_deinit(void)
00101 {
00102   spi->CTRL = 0;
00103 
00104   /* IO configuration (USART 0, Location #0) */
00105   GPIO_PinModeSet(MICROSD_GPIOPORT, MICROSD_MOSIPIN, gpioModeDisabled, 0);  /* MOSI */
00106   GPIO_PinModeSet(MICROSD_GPIOPORT, MICROSD_MISOPIN, gpioModeDisabled, 0);  /* MISO */
00107   GPIO_PinModeSet(MICROSD_GPIOPORT, MICROSD_CSPIN, gpioModeDisabled, 0);  /* CS */
00108   GPIO_PinModeSet(MICROSD_GPIOPORT, MICROSD_CLKPIN, gpioModeDisabled, 0);  /* Clock */
00109 }

00111 /**************************************************************************/
00121 uint8_t xfer_spi(uint8_t data)
00122 {
00123 
00124   spi->TXDATA = data;
00125   while (!(spi->STATUS & USART_STATUS_TXC))
00126   {
00127   }
00128   return (uint8_t)(spi->RXDATA);
00129 }
00130 
00131 /**************************************************************************/
00135 static uint8_t wait_ready(void)
00136 {
00137   uint8_t res;
00138   /* Wait for ready in timeout of 500ms */
00139   Timer1 = 500;
00140   do
00141     res = xfer_spi(0xff);
00142   while ((res != 0xFF) && Timer1);
00143   return res;
00144 }
00145 
00146 /**************************************************************************/
00149 void deselect(void)
00150 {
00151   CS_HIGH();
00152   xfer_spi(0xff);
00153 }
00154 
00155 /**************************************************************************/
00159 int select(void)
00160 {
00161   CS_LOW();
00162   if (wait_ready() != 0xFF)
00163   {
00164     deselect();
00165     return 0;
00166   }
00167   return 1;
00168 }
00169 
00170 /**************************************************************************/
00174 void power_on(void)
00175 {
00176   /* Enable SPI */
00177   CMU_ClockEnable(MICROSD_CMUCLOCK, true);
00178 }
00179 
00180 /**************************************************************************/
00184 void power_off(void)
00185 {
00186   /* Wait for card ready */
00187   select();
00188   deselect();
00189   /* Disable USART0 */
00190   CMU_ClockEnable(MICROSD_CMUCLOCK, false);
00191   /* Set STA_NOINIT */
00192   Stat |= STA_NOINIT;
00193 }

00195 /**************************************************************************/
00204 int rcvr_datablock(uint8_t *buff, uint32_t btr)
00205 {
00206   uint8_t     token;
00207   uint16_t *buff_16 = (uint16_t *) buff;
00208   uint32_t framectrl;
00209   uint32_t ctrl;
00210 
00211   /* Wait for data packet in timeout of 100ms */
00212   Timer1 = 100;
00213   do
00214     token = xfer_spi(0xff);
00215   while ((token == 0xFF) && (Timer1 > 0));
00216 
00217   if (token != 0xFE)
00218     /* Invalid data token */
00219     return 0;
00220 
00221   /* Clear send and receive buffer */
00222   spi->CMD = USART_CMD_CLEARRX | USART_CMD_CLEARTX;
00223   /* Store old configuration. */
00224   framectrl = spi->FRAME;
00225   ctrl      = spi->CTRL;
00226   /* Set up frames to 16 bit on each frame. This will increase the
00227    * data rate and make the maximum use of the buffers available. */
00228   spi->FRAME = (spi->FRAME & (~_USART_FRAME_DATABITS_MASK))
00229                | USART_FRAME_DATABITS_SIXTEEN;
00230   spi->CTRL = (spi->CTRL & (~_USART_CTRL_BYTESWAP_MASK))
00231               | USART_CTRL_BYTESWAP;
00232   while (!(spi->STATUS & USART_STATUS_TXBL)) ;
00233   /* Pipelining - The USART has two buffers of 16 bit in both
00234    * directions. Make sure that at least one is in the pipe at all
00235    * times to maximize throughput. */
00236   spi->TXDOUBLE = 0xffff;
00237   /* Receive the data block into buffer */
00238   do
00239   {
00240     spi->TXDOUBLE = 0xffff;
00241     while (!(spi->STATUS & USART_STATUS_RXFULL)) ;
00242     *buff_16++ = (uint16_t) spi->RXDOUBLE;
00243   } while (btr -= 2);
00244 
00245   /* Next two bytes is the CRC which we discard. */
00246   while (!(spi->STATUS & USART_STATUS_RXFULL)) ;
00247   spi->CMD = USART_CMD_CLEARRX;
00248 
00249   /* Restore 8-bit operation */
00250   spi->FRAME = framectrl;
00251   spi->CTRL  = ctrl;
00252 
00253   return 1;     /* Return with success */
00254 }

00256 /**************************************************************************/
00262 #if _READONLY == 0
00263 int xmit_datablock(const uint8_t *buff, uint8_t token)
00264 {
00265   uint8_t resp;
00266   uint32_t bc = 512;
00267 
00268   if (wait_ready() != 0xFF)
00269     return 0;
00270 
00271   xfer_spi(token);          /* Xmit a token */
00272   if (token != 0xFD)
00273   {                         /* Not StopTran token */
00274     do
00275     {
00276       /* Xmit the 512 byte data block to the MMC */
00277       xfer_spi(*buff++);
00278       xfer_spi(*buff++);
00279     } while (bc -= 2);
00280 
00281     xfer_spi(0xFF);             /* CRC (Dummy) */
00282     xfer_spi(0xFF);
00283     resp = xfer_spi(0xff);      /* Receive a data response */
00284     if ((resp & 0x1F) != 0x05)  /* If not accepted, return with error */
00285       return 0;
00286   }
00287   return 1;
00288 }
00289 #endif  /* _READONLY */
00290 
00291 /**************************************************************************/
00304 uint8_t send_cmd(uint8_t cmd, DWORD arg)
00305 {
00306   uint8_t         n, res;
00307   volatile int timeOut;
00308 
00309   if (cmd & 0x80)
00310   { /* ACMD<n> is the command sequense of CMD55-CMD<n> */
00311     cmd &= 0x7F;
00312     res  = send_cmd(CMD55, 0);
00313     if (res > 1) return res;
00314   }
00315 
00316   /* Select the card and wait for ready */
00317   deselect();
00318   if (!select())
00319     return 0xFF;
00320 
00321   /* Send command packet */
00322   xfer_spi(0x40 | cmd);           /* Start + Command index */
00323   xfer_spi((uint8_t)(arg >> 24));    /* Argument[31..24] */
00324   xfer_spi((uint8_t)(arg >> 16));    /* Argument[23..16] */
00325   xfer_spi((uint8_t)(arg >> 8));     /* Argument[15..8] */
00326   xfer_spi((uint8_t) arg);           /* Argument[7..0] */
00327   n = 0x01;                       /* Dummy CRC + Stop */
00328   if (cmd == CMD0)
00329     n = 0x95;                     /* Valid CRC for CMD0(0) */
00330   if (cmd == CMD8)
00331     n = 0x87;                     /* Valid CRC for CMD8(0x1AA) */
00332   xfer_spi(n);
00333 
00334   /* Receive command response */
00335   if (cmd == CMD12)
00336     xfer_spi(0xff);               /* Skip a stuff byte when stop reading */
00337   timeOut = 10;                   /* Wait for a valid response in timeout of 10 attempts */
00338   do
00339     res = xfer_spi(0xff);
00340   while ((res & 0x80) && --timeOut);
00341 
00342   return res;             /* Return with the response value */
00343 }
